issuer.summary: issued by The Australian Power Institute

badge_template_activities.title: Awardees submit an online application (written and video message) detailing their interest in working in the Australian power sector and how joining the API Bursary scholarship community would assist them in developing a rewarding career in power. Must be completing an undergraduate university course in a STEM program aligned with the needs of the power sector (1st, 2nd or 3rd year of study). Applications are reviewed by a panel of representatives from the API's member organisations.

Earners are invited into the API's Bursary student community of 100+ undergraduate students across Australia and support, resources and opportunities to develop their knowledge, experience and passion for rewarding careers in the power sector. Earners are supported with a $1000/year cash scholarship and opportunities to connect with industry professionals and other students, to attend industry conferences and events, and to complete at least one paid summer work placement in industry.

Awardees commit to particpating in the API's program for Bursary students including live and online 'Sparking Connections' mentoring sessions with API member organisation representatives, online Industry Insight webinars, Students in Power Summit featuring videos by students completing paid summer work placements with API members, at least 1x paid work placement with an API member organisation, and school outreach activities to inspire the next generation.
